clinical_study.brief_title: Measurement of Eye Blood Flow and Renal Function in Healthy and Diabetic Patients
clinical_study.official_title: Eye Blood Flow and the Kidney

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to the determine the effect of salt intake and Captopril on the ophthalmic artery (OA) blood supply of individuals with Type 2 Diabetes Mellitus.

detailed_description.textblock:
The overall objective of this study is to ascertain if salt intake affects ophthalmic artery (OA) blood flow. In addition, we will study both the eye and kidney response to ACE inhibition compared to placebo while controlling salt intake in subjects with Type 2 diabetes mellitus.
We hypothesize that salt intake will affect OA blood flow.
We will initially look at both eye and renal response to subjects on a low salt diet (10mEq Na/day) followed by response to high salt diet (200mEq Na/day). In addition, we may look at eye response while subjects consume their regular diet.

primary_outcome.measure: Change in ophthalmic artery blood flow from baseline
primary_outcome.time_frame: 1 hour post drug, 2 hours post drug, 3 hours post drug
primary_outcome.description: Eye blood flow will be measured at baseline and post drug time points (3 total)

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in blood pressure from baseline
secondary_outcome.description: Blood pressure will be monitored throughout the study starting at baseline

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in renal plasma flow (RPF) from baseline
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 1 hour post drug, 2 hours post drug, 3 hours post drug
secondary_outcome.description: Renal Plasma Flow (to measure kidney function) will be measured at baseline and post drug time points (3 total)

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Type 2 Diabetes Mellitus
Exclusion Criteria:
- Type 1 Diabetes Mellitus
- Heart Attack or Stroke within the last 6 months
- Pregnant or lactating females
